This course was proposed by a Danish researcher Louis Hjelmslev.
In 1935 Hjelmslev presented his work Prolegomena to a Theory of Language in which he gave a conception basis of glossematics.
He was unsatisfied with linguistic science contemporary to him because it was a blend of history, sociology, philosophy and other sciences.
From his point of view, the science can be independent only when it is self-limited.
Louis Hjelmslev called this particular field of linguistics a special term glossematics in order not to confuse it with linguistics in its general way.
Thus, he defined glossematics as a linguistic area which considers the language by means of mathematical and logical aspects without researching the substance and real sound.
Basically, this book contains the main aspects of language examination with the use of glossematics methods.
As they both were Hjelmslev's pupils, the above-mentioned principles were configured in a really effective way.

Many linguists mentioned practical uselessness of glossematics, because within the scope of this stream the language is perceived as a complicated mathematical system in which only synchronous data are elaborated.
Besides, from the beginning of formulating their theory, gloccematicans maintained that linguistics has to function without any connection with other kinds of science.
Therefore, the description of the language comes to the analyses of interrelations between functions, but not to the analyses of real content (sound and substance).

Nowadays the glossematics is realized as an outdated approach and, thus current researches are not devoted to the question of the comparison between a natural language system and a mathematical system.
